summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Spencer Kuvin regarding the notification of Jeffrey Epstein's work release. The email includes an attachment of the work release notice intended for Kuvin's clients.

persons.name: Spencer Kuvin
persons.context: Attorney receiving notification of Jeffrey Epstein's work release on behalf of his clients.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the work release notification being communicated to his attorney's clients.

persons.name: Mr. Leopold
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who may have previously been sent an email about Epstein's release that did not go through.

connections.description: Kuvin is acting as defense attorney for Epstein, receiving official notifications about his release on his behalf.
Kuvin is copied or referenced in correspondence where Leopold was an intended recipient of Epstein's release notification.

events.title: Work Release Notification for Epstein
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney sends notification of Jeffrey Epstein's work release to defense attorney Spencer Kuvin for distribution to his clients.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on work release as of December 2008.
Defense attorney Spencer Kuvin was representing Epstein and receiving official notifications about his release status.
The U.S. Attorney's office in West Palm Beach was handling communications regarding Epstein's work release.
The notification was intended for Kuvin's clients, suggesting multiple parties with legal interest in Epstein's release status.
